list_definition.definition: the ground at the edge of a river, lake etc
a mound or ridge (of earth etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She climbed up the bank to pick some flowers.

list_definition.definition: a raised area of sand under the sea
(often with up) to form into a bank or banks

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The earth was banked up against the wall of the house.

list_definition.definition: to tilt (an aircraft etc) while turning
a place where money is lent or exchanged, or put for safety and/or to acquire interest

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has plenty of money in the bank
I must go to the bank today.

list_definition.definition: a place for storing other valuable material

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He banks his wages every Friday.

list_definition.definition: a collection of rows (of instruments etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The pilot has to check several banks of instruments before take-off.
